title: Constraint-Led Training Design Workshop for Sports Skill Acquisition

context.prior_knowledge: Basic sports science knowledge and understanding of exercise biomechanics
context.additional_context: Learners are general citizens interested in data-driven training design, possessing intermediate-level sports science knowledge

learning_goals: Learners can design sports skill training programs using a constraint-led approach.
Learners can optimize training constraints by applying machine learning techniques (decision trees/clustering analysis).
Learners can develop training scenarios based on Representative Learning Design (RLD) that reflect real-game environments.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
